I agree w/ @POTUS: b/c of Turkey’s decision to purchase the Russian S-400 air defense systems, we had no choice but to end its involvement w/ our F-35 program. The S-400 program can be used to learn about the F-35s advanced stealth capability – a threat to our national security.

Since 2016, I have introduced legislation called the RESPECT Act that would repeal a number of these outdated laws. This week, I introduced it again. This time w/ bicameral, bipartisan support. We're optimistic we'll get it signed into law this Congress.   https://www.rounds.senate.gov/newsroom/weekly-column/showing-respect-to-native-americans …

Throughout history, Native Americans have been subjected to federal laws that are offensive, immoral and outright racist. Sadly, a number of these laws are still on the books today. While they are not enforced, there is no reason for them to be a part of our federal code.

Over the years, I’ve had the privilege of establishing friendships with tribal members from all 9 reservations in SD. One of the issues we talk about is the emotional toll our sometimes-dark past has on our Native American neighbors today.
I’ll continue to work in the Senate to support patient-centered, market-based reforms that are truly affordable.
Every American deserves access to quality, affordable health care coverage, but Obamacare is not the answer, nor is socialized medicine run by the government.

Earlier this year, I introduced with Senator @MartinHeinrich the Middle Class Health Benefits Tax Repeal Act, to permanently repeal this tax. Our legislation has bipartisan support from more than 40 cosponsors who are working hard to advance it in the Senate.

I've also been working to provide SD families with relief from Obamacare. This includes repealing the Cadillac Tax: a 40% tax on health coverage that exceeds predetermined amounts. This tax, if implemented, would affect nearly 450,000 SD'ans with employer-sponsored health care.

While we continue our work to repeal & replace Obamacare, we’re committed to making sure pre-existing conditions are protected for individuals that maintain continuous coverage, the guaranteed renewal of coverage and allowing children to remain on their parents’ plans until 26.
We also had 17 different providers offering group health insurance before Obamacare. Today, we have just two.

In South Dakota, we had guaranteed renewability and guaranteed portability before Obamacare came along. We also allowed children in school to stay on their parents’ insurance until the age of 29. Under Obamacare, it went down to 26.

Let’s set the record straight: Obamacare has been a disaster from the start for millions of people who were forced off the health care plans they liked & who now pay higher & higher premiums each month, while having fewer plans to choose from as providers leave the marketplace.

This week, the 5th Circuit Court of Appeals heard arguments in a lawsuit seeking to overturn Obamacare. Democrats have been working overtime to paint the @GOP as a monster that wants to rip health insurance away from 20 million people. That couldn’t be further from the truth.

Our bipartisan bill would provide much-needed transparency to the EPA’s waiver process. More here:  https://www.rounds.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/rounds-cosponsors-bill-to-make-rfs-small-refinery-waiver-process-more-transparent …
